Participants.evidence: Individuals with lower limb varicose veins and incompetence of GSV were randomly assigned to two treatment groups

Intervention.evidence: randomly assigned to two treatment groups: EA and RFA

Objective.evidence: Objective: Thermoablation is increasingly being used as an alternative to traditional surgery for treating primary varicose veins.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome measured was GSV occlusion, evaluated through postoperative duplex ultrasound examination.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: randomly assigned to two treatment groups

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 57 patients were included

Result_Outcome.evidence: occlusion rates of 89.7% for the EA group (n = 29) and 66.7% for the RFA group (n = 30) ( P = .001)

Harms.evidence: There were no procedure-related complications ( P = .127)
